remarks: Congruence law for the general five segment configuration.  Theorem 4.16 of [Schwabhauser] p. 37.  (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 27-Apr-2019.)
statement:
tglngval.p $e |- P = ( Base ` G ) $.
tglngval.l $e |- L = ( LineG ` G ) $.
tglngval.i $e |- I = ( Itv ` G ) $.
tglngval.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. TarskiG ) $.
tglngval.x $e |- ( ph -> X e. P ) $.
tglngval.y $e |- ( ph -> Y e. P ) $.
tgcolg.z $e |- ( ph -> Z e. P ) $.
lnxfr.r $e |- .~ = ( cgrG ` G ) $.
lnxfr.a $e |- ( ph -> A e. P ) $.
lnxfr.b $e |- ( ph -> B e. P ) $.
lnxfr.d $e |- .- = ( dist ` G ) $.
tgfscgr.t $e |- ( ph -> T e. P ) $.
tgfscgr.c $e |- ( ph -> C e. P ) $.
tgfscgr.d $e |- ( ph -> D e. P ) $.
tgfscgr.1 $e |- ( ph -> ( Y e. ( X L Z ) \/ X = Z ) ) $.
tgfscgr.2 $e |- ( ph -> <" X Y Z "> .~ <" A B C "> ) $.
tgfscgr.3 $e |- ( ph -> ( X .- T ) = ( A .- D ) ) $.
tgfscgr.4 $e |- ( ph -> ( Y .- T ) = ( B .- D ) ) $.
tgfscgr.5 $e |- ( ph -> X =/= Y ) $.
tgfscgr $p |- ( ph -> ( Z .- T ) = ( C .- D ) ) $.
